column4: at what point does it not boot? you can always check in /var/log if there are error messages in any of the logs.
it failed to load NVIDIA kernel module
I have nvidia-glx-185 installed... not sure how to go about configuring it though
modprobe nvidia results in FATAL error... if that means anything
FATAL: Could not load /lib/modules/2.6.32-28-generic/modules.dep: No such file or directory  being the exact message
hm... can you do "$ uname -a" and paste that?
well, but it uses the same kernel that is used normally, right?
i just try to figure out if it even trys to load the correct modules for the correct kernel. So I compare 2.6...
mangdood this may be more relevant: http://pastie.org/2522287
and then, I just look for an apt-get way to uninstall all your nvidia stuff and reinstall it... :) But never done it with apt-get, myself... :)
I think I did that. and that's what brought me to this state :p
system's kernel log, maybe that says more... but mangdood is probably right, try the open source version...
mangdood says it: the nvidia drivers are proprietary and not allowed. Possible that you screwed it up trying to install those instead of the default ubuntu open source ones... :)
